column4: Does anyone know where I could get WebKit 1.1.17 as a binary (.deb or download from Synaptic)?
compile it, webkit doesnt have that many dependencies
Where do I get the binary for WebKit 1.1.17? I know where to get 1.1.18 and 1.1.15 and the like, but I haven't had luck finding it.
you can check out pretty much any version using svn
besides why 1.1.17, midori will happily work with latest webkit
1.1.18? According to the #midori devs, it's extremely buggy. I was on #midori earlier.
oh i see. here http://trac.webkit.org/browser/releases/WebKitGTK/webkit-1.1.17
This is the error I get as a result of 1.1.18: midori: symbol lookup error: /usr/lib/libwebkit-1.0.so.2: undefined symbol: soup_content_decoder_get_type
thats the source though, so you'll have to compile
did you install libsoup?
and libsoup-dev
those libs are a part of gtk if im not mistaken
Yes, but I ended up compiling it since said error message above I think had to do with libsoup.
Using git.
yep when i was building it on debian squeze which had incomplete gtk, ie not completely up to date, i had to compile libsoup, but midori worked just fine with latest webkit the way i remember it
make sure you configure all that midori related stuff with --prefix=/usr/local as not to cause conflict with libraries from package manager
It worked with 1.1.18?
yea i think so
im not sure about the exact version but i was using latest trunk of webkit
Hm... I'll try compiling libsoup and the like again. I git cloned webkit earlier myself.
that was about two months ago, not sure if webkit was up to 1.1.18 back then
Ahhh. That was 1.1.17u.
oh. yea i dont want to go through the excercise of compiling midori again, otherwise i'd be of more help, i just use chromium now
Yea... I lliked midori over chromium though, hence my trying to compile it. xD
